heading: 3.1 Sites table
text: Observations measurements site. site table please use (least) following columns.

heading: 3.1.1 id.layer_uuid_c
text: Unique layer ID: best generated using UUID generator tool; example: id.layer_uuid_c = '672d1fd6-b186-11eb-8a61-7446a0925130'

heading: 3.1.2 id.location_olc_c
text:
Unique Open Location Codes: ID identifies site location; example: id.location_olc_c = '84MVX5FH+PJ'
recommend rounding latitude longitude coordinates 6 decimal places.

heading: 3.1.3 observation.ogc.schema.title_ogc_txt
text: Observation OGC schema title; example: observation.ogc.schema.title_ogc_txt = 'Open Soil Spectral Library Schema'

heading: 3.1.4 observation.ogc.schema_idn_url
text: Observation OGC schema URL; example: observation.ogc.schema_idn_url = 'https://github.com/soilspectroscopy/'

heading: 3.1.5 observation.date.begin_iso.8601_yyyy.mm.dd
text: Observation date begin (ISO8601); example: observation.date.begin_iso.8601_yyyy.mm.dd = '2000.02.10'

heading: 3.1.6 observation.date.end_iso.8601_yyyy.mm.dd
text: Observation date end (ISO8601); example: observation.date.end_iso.8601_yyyy.mm.dd = '2000.02.10'

heading: 3.1.7 location.address_utf8_txt
text: Location address Street number, Local postcode, Town, County, State; example: location.address_utf8_txt = ''

text: Country(ies) data /collected (ISO3166); example: location.country_iso.3166_c = 'USA'

heading: 3.1.9 location.method_any_c
text: Location method e.g. GPS; example: location.method_any_c = 'GPS'

heading: 3.1.10 surveyor.title_utf8_txt
text: Field surveyor title organization; example: surveyor.title_utf8_txt = 'USDA Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS) staff'

heading: 3.1.11 surveyor.contact_ietf_email
text: Field surveyor contact email; example: surveyor.contact_ietf_email = 'support@usda.gov'

heading: 3.2.14 agg.stb_usda.1b1_wpct

heading: 3.2.15 al.dith_usda.4g1_wpct
text: Aluminum, dithionite-citrate extractable; description: al.dith_usda.4g1_wpct = Dithionite citrate extractable aluminum indicator amount aluminum substituted iron iron oxides. necessarily represent total pedogenic Al.

heading: 3.2.16 al.kcl_usda.4b3_cmolkg
text:

heading: 3.2.17 al.ox_usda.4g2_wpct
text: Aluminum, ammonium oxalate extractable; description: al.ox_usda.4g2_wpct = Ammonium oxalate extractable aluminum estimate total pedogenic Al, much may noncrystalline materials complexed organic matter. reported gravimetric percent <2 mm base.

heading: 3.2.18 al.pyp_usda.4g3_wpct
text: Aluminum, sodium pyrophosphate extractable; description: al.pyp_usda.4g3_wpct = Sodium pyrophosphate extractable aluminum fraction extracted 0.1M sodium pyrophosphate. originally considered portion associated organic compounds, although subsequent evidence indicates forms also removed.

text: Aluminum saturation; description: alsat_usda.4b4_wpct = Aluminum saturation calculated (AL_KCL/(Sum bases))*100. provides inference potential Al toxicity problems, although many factors influence Al toxicity.

heading: 3.2.20 bd.clod_usda.3b1_gcm3
text: Bulk density clod, <2 mm fraction, 1/3 bar; description: bd.clod_usda.3b1_gcm3 = Bulk density, <2 mm fraction, 1/3 bar weight per unit volume <2 mm fraction, volume measured equilibration 1/3 bar water tension. reported grams per cubic centimeter <2 mm base.

heading: 3.2.21 bd.core_iso.11272.2017_gcm3
text:
Dry bulk density based ISO 11272:2017(en)

heading: 3.2.22 bd.od_usda.3b2_gcm3
text:

Measurements made known volume cores. reported grams per cubic centimeter, <2 mm base.🆔 bd.od_usda.3b2_gcm3📚 Measurement unit: g/cm3🔬 Laboratory method: Oven-Dry📖 Scientific reference: Grossman & Reinsch (2002)
